intro: Carpinus betulus f. variegata, commonly known as the variegated hornbeam, is a decorative cultivar of the European hornbeam. It is characterized by its striking variegated foliage, which features white and yellow markings on dark green leaves. This plant is a deciduous shrub or small tree, typically growing to a height of 6 to 10 meters. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a smooth margin and turn yellow in autumn. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by edible, round berries that are a food source for birds.
